citations.narrative:
***Approximately forty percent of the sugar glider enclosures have severe rust and/or corrosion. The condition of the
surfaces of the enclosures is inhibiting the enclosures from adequate cleaning and sanitation. There is a sticky layer
accumulating on the wires and joints in the rusty areas. Improper maintenance of the enclosures may increase risk of
disease hazards, weakening of the structural strength of the enclosure and and contamination.
The enclosures shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
contain the animals.

***The sugar glider room has not been thoroughly cleaned resulting in an excessive accumulation of waste material on
the cage racks and floor. The room has a strong smell of ammonia and waste. The walls behind the cages and window
sills have waste material splashed and dried on them and it has also accumulated on the base of the hanging water
bottles. Accumulations of waste material can lead to increased presence of insects and vermin which may cause
contamination of feed, discomfort and illness.
The room shall be cleaned and maintained in a manner to facilitate proper husbandry practices to provide for the health
and well-being of the sugar gliders.

***There is a large amount of flying insects present in the sugar glider room. There are 14 fly strips hung throughout the
room and all of the strips are full. During the inspection the inspector was continually swiping at gnats while speaking.
Exposing the sugar gliders to excess flying insects may cause distress and contamination of food and illness.
A safe and effective program for the control of insects and ectoparasites shall be established and maintained to provide
for the health and well-being of the sugar gliders
The inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
***Approximately forty percent of the sugar glider enclosures have severe rust and/or corrosion. The condition of the 
surfaces of the enclosures is inhibiting the enclosures from adequate cleaning and sanitation. There is a sticky layer 
accumulating on the wires and joints in the rusty areas. Improper maintenance of the enclosures may increase risk of 
disease hazards, weakening of the structural strength of the enclosure and and contamination. 
 
The enclosures shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to 
contain the animals. 
3.131(c)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
***The sugar glider room has not been thoroughly cleaned resulting in an excessive accumulation of waste material on 
the cage racks and floor. The room has a strong smell of ammonia and waste. The walls behind the cages and window 
sills have waste material splashed and dried on them and it has also accumulated on the base of the hanging water 
bottles. Accumulations of waste material can lead to increased presence of insects and vermin which may cause 
contamination of feed, discomfort and illness.  
 
The room shall be cleaned and maintained in a manner to facilitate proper husbandry practices to provide for the health 
and well-being of the sugar gliders. 
3.131(d)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
***There is a large amount of flying insects present in the sugar glider room. There are 14 fly strips hung throughout the 
room and all of the strips are full. During the inspection the inspector was continually swiping at gnats while speaking. 
Exposing the sugar gliders to excess flying insects may cause distress and contamination of food and illness. 
 
 A safe and effective program for the control of insects and ectoparasites shall be established and maintained to provide 
for the health and well-being of the sugar gliders

The inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
